results.title: Unknown Chaplin
results.creator_credit: Thames Television, Kevin Brownlow and David Gill
results.brief_description: A three part series which both surveys and throws new light on Chaplin’s career in films. The first part, My Happiest Years, covers his work in 2 reel comedies. The second part, The Great Dictator, covers his early years as the independent producer of The Kid and The Gold Rush. The third part, Hidden Treasures, includes previously unseen home movies and scenes cut from the release prints of City Lights and Modern Times. Narrated by James Mason.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thames Television, Kevin Brownlow and David Gill
results.description: A three part series which both surveys and throws new light on Chaplin’s career in films. The first part, My Happiest Years, covers his work in 2 reel comedies. The second part, The Great Dictator, covers his early years as the independent producer of The Kid and The Gold Rush. The third part, Hidden Treasures, includes previously unseen home movies and scenes cut from the release prints of City Lights and Modern Times. Narrated by James Mason.

results.title: University secretary
results.creator_credit: University of Minnesota. Audio-Visual Education Service and Bill Jensen
results.brief_description: The do’s and don’ts for a receptionist/secretary in a large organisation. Betty, as secretary for several people in a university department, is untidy, inefficient and frightened to ask questions which would help in her work. After one particularly muddled day she decides to change; she finds tidiness aids efficiency, questions save valuable time and she learns to schedule the work as priority dictates.
results.creator_credit_for_label: University of Minnesota. Audio-Visual Education Service and Bill Jensen

results.title: University of flying
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Maxwell Munden
results.brief_description: Men of all nationalities attend the Empire Test Pilot School at Cranfield, UK, for it is the only school of its kind in the world. Its purpose is to make men who are already experienced pilots into test pilots, for aircraft companies and Government establishments are always in need of test pilots.

results.title: Universities of Australia
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Geoffrey Bell and Malcolm Otton
results.brief_description: An account of the growth of Australia’s universities and a survey of their contribution to our national life. The technological contribution to the nation, based on the scientific work of the universities, is stressed and the need for additional and continued support for the institutions is emphasised.

results.title: Universities in Japan
results.brief_description: Impressions of student life at the many Japanese universities are included in this survey of academic courses available. Educational and research facilities being used by students, post-graduate students and research fellows are also shown.

results.title: Universities at war
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Graham McInnes and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: Canadian universities made many contributions to the war effort through research and applications in many disciplines including engineering, medicine, psychiatry, chemistry, agriculture and sociology. Many of these developments were also envisioned as having important peacetime applications.
